title: Just found this, thought it was interesting

embed.description: Well, At the moment I have my League Client open and it is stuck at 33% and at the top it has been saying \"Calculating differences/\" For a long time, the number has gone up to 2000, what do I do? I have tried running League as an admin, but still didn't work.

body:
So my patcher was stuck at 33% again, after I only just patched my client yesterday. So as I do every time ((this happens every patch)) I found this, and haven't actually seen it before.

The part I found especially interesting, was the guy who actually went and searched into Riot's servers, and all their IPs and everything.
From what he thinks, this "33% error" is a problem on Riots end.
Further through the comments the poster actually sends his patch-log, and a Riot employee states he has been disconnecting after about 30 seconds, where as the poster says he has left it patching for hours.

I just found it interesting to read, and wondered. Should this be looked into by Riot, that maybe the issue is a disconnection or something on their end.

replies.body:
It's definitely a problem on their end. I got told the same thing about it, and I'm able to play League just fine after I manually download the patch.

I'm more suspecting it's something to do with the program and the way it handles files you already have, not just the connection. I mean, why would it **always** be at 33%?
